Both the innate and the adaptive immune response have an essential role in recognizing and eliminating foreign pathogens. Accumulating evidence suggests that a suboptimal or unrestrained immune response during SARS-CoV-2 infection drives the clinical patterns, disease severity and progression of COVID-19. Identification of specific immune signatures may provide novel insights into the divergent disease trajectories observed in individual patients and aid the design of more targeted therapeutic approaches
